title: Vitamin B12 deficiency anemia
summary: Vitamin B12 deficiency anemia, of which pernicious anemia (PA) is a type,[8] is a disease in which not enough red blood cells are produced due to a deficiency of vitamin B12.[5] The most common initial symptom is  feeling tiredness and weakness.[4] Other symptoms may include shortness of breath, pale skin, feeling like one is going to pass out (lightheadedness), chest pain, rapid heartbeat, numbness in the hands and feet, poor balance, a frequent fall of blood pressure, loss of appetite, a smooth red tongue, memory problems, poor reflexes, and in severe cases depression and confusion.[4] Without treatment some of these problems may become permanent.[5]
